# "Assignment 2"

### 1. Display the first 10 rows of the dataset using `kable()` function (1 marks). 

```{r}

knitr::kable(data[1:10, 1:10], "simple")

Data2 <- head(data)
knitr::kable(Data2, "simple", "col.names" = gsub("_", " ", names(data)), align = "c", caption = NULL)
```

### 2. Using `skim()` display the summary of variables. 

```{r}
skim(data)


data %>% 
  group_by(main_dish) %>% 
  count(main_dish)

Turkey <- data %>% 
  filter(main_dish == "Turkey")

data %>% 
  group_by(family_income) %>% 
  count(family_income)

data %>% 
  group_by(us_region) %>% 
 count(us_region)

Turkey %>% 
  group_by(us_region) %>% 
  filter(celebrate == "Yes") %>% 
  count(celebrate) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(n,us_region))+
  geom_point()+
  coord_flip()

```
